meanings.definition: A person who complains or grumbles frequently.
meanings.sent1: The grouser in our class always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: The old man at the park is known as the local grouser.
meanings.sent3: The grouser at the restaurant kept sending his food back.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was a grouser, always finding fault in everything.
meanings.sent5: The grouser's constant complaints made everyone avoid him.

meanings.definition: A metal projection on the sole of a shoe to prevent slipping.
meanings.sent1: The hiker's boots had sturdy grousers that helped him climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent2: The icy sidewalk was no match for the shoes with grousers.
meanings.sent3: The clever inventor added grousers to the shoes for better grip on ice.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's shoes had sharp grousers that dug into the track for traction.
meanings.sent5: The mountaineer relied on the grousers to navigate the slippery slope.

meanings.sent1: She would grouse about the weather every morning.
meanings.sent2: The customer began to grouse about the slow service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: He would grouse good-naturedly about his messy desk.
meanings.sent4: The child started to grouse when told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent5: The workers would grouse about the long hours but still get the job done.
